definition.name: Privileged Requester
definition.description: Checks a PR against configurable criteria to determine whether or not the PR should be automatically approved
definition.author: github

inputs.name: github_token
inputs.description:
'The GitHub token used to create an authenticated client - Provided for you by default! - Repository scoped token'

You can use the default provided token or you can provide a PAT as an alternative robot user token

inputs.name: handle
inputs.description: When using the default github.token (from above), the "handle" is fetched from this input since the token is repository scoped and it cannot even read its own handle. You should not need to change this input.

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: Path where the privileged requester configuration can be found

inputs.name: prCreator
inputs.description: The creator of the PR for this pull request event

inputs.name: prNumber
inputs.description: The number of the PR for this pull request event

inputs.name: checkCommits
inputs.description: An option to check that every commit in the PR is made from the privileged requester

inputs.name: checkDiff
inputs.description: An option to check that the PR diff only has a removal diff, with no additions

inputs.name: checkLabels
inputs.description: An option to check that the labels on the PR match those defined in the privileged requester config

inputs.name: commitVerification
inputs.description: Whether or not to validate all commits have proper verification via GPG signed commits

inputs.name: fallback_to_commit_author
inputs.description: Whether or not to fallback to the commit author value if the commit login value is missing

outputs.name: approved
outputs.description: Whether or not the PR was approved - 'true' or 'false'

outputs.name: commits_verified
outputs.description: The string "true" if all commits in the PR are signed/verified
